jobs.title: Enable Self-Service Framework Learning
jobs.statement: When I need to onboard new team members to the Claude framework, I want to provide an interactive documentation platform with visual hierarchy and integrated examples, so I can enable self-service learning without manual training sessions.
jobs.when: I need to onboard new team members to the Claude framework
jobs.i_want_to: provide an interactive documentation platform with visual hierarchy and integrated examples
jobs.so_that: I can enable self-service learning without manual training sessions
jobs.frequency: Daily - every new team member onboarding
jobs.importance: Blocks scalable knowledge transfer and team productivity
success_criteria: New team members can explore framework structure independently within first hour
Trainer time reduced by 80% per new team member
All framework components are discoverable without file system navigation
Post-training retention rate > 90% after 1 week (measured by ability to locate tools)
jobs.desired_state: Interactive web interface with hierarchical navigation, collapsible sections, and search

jobs.title: Understand Framework Component Context
jobs.statement: When I'm exploring a framework skill, command, or agent, I want to see purpose, usage examples, options, and workflow diagrams in a unified view, so I can understand when and how to use it correctly.
jobs.when: I'm exploring a framework skill, command, or agent
jobs.i_want_to: see purpose, usage examples, options, and workflow diagrams in a unified view
jobs.so_that: I can understand when and how to use it correctly
jobs.frequency: Multiple times per day during active framework usage
jobs.importance: Prevents tool misuse and reduces learning curve
success_criteria: Every component shows purpose, examples, and workflow in one view
Users can answer "when to use X vs Y" within 30 seconds
Example usage patterns are visible without reading source code
High-level workflow diagrams show component relationships
jobs.current_state: Reading individual markdown files, mentally piecing together context
jobs.desired_state: Multi-section detail pane with tabs: Purpose | Examples | Options | Workflow | Traceability

jobs.title: Quickly Find Relevant Framework Tools
jobs.statement: When I have a specific product discovery or implementation task, I want to search and filter framework components by capability, stage, or tag, so I can find the right tool without browsing folder structures.
jobs.when: I have a specific product discovery or implementation task
jobs.i_want_to: search and filter framework components by capability, stage, or tag
jobs.so_that: I can find the right tool without browsing folder structures
jobs.frequency: 3-5 times per week when starting new tasks
success_criteria: Search results appear within 2 seconds of typing query
Can filter by stage (Discovery, Prototype, Implementation, Utility)
Can tag components (e.g., "JTBD extraction", "code generation")
Search includes skill/command/agent names, descriptions, and keywords
jobs.desired_state: Search bar with instant results and multi-faceted filters

jobs.title: Understand Which Tools Apply to Current Workflow Stage
jobs.statement: When I'm in a specific workflow phase (e.g., Discovery, Prototype, Implementation), I want to visually filter framework components by stage, so I can focus only on relevant tools without mental mapping.
jobs.when: I'm in a specific workflow phase (e.g., Discovery, Prototype, Implementation)
jobs.i_want_to: visually filter framework components by stage
jobs.so_that: I can focus only on relevant tools without mental mapping
jobs.frequency: Daily - every time user switches workflow phases
jobs.importance: Reduces cognitive load and prevents using wrong-stage tools
success_criteria: Components are visually grouped by Discovery, Prototype, ProductSpecs, SolArch, Implementation stages
Can toggle stage filter to hide irrelevant tools
Stage badges are visible on every component card
Stage-specific landing pages show only phase-appropriate tools
jobs.current_state: Mentally mapping file names (Discovery_*, Prototype_*) to workflow stages
jobs.desired_state: Visual stage filters with color-coded badges and grouped layouts

jobs.title: Edit Framework Source Files Efficiently
jobs.statement: When I want to customize or extend a framework component, I want to copy the file path with one click, so I can open it in my editor without navigating the file system.
jobs.when: I want to customize or extend a framework component
jobs.i_want_to: copy the file path with one click
jobs.so_that: I can open it in my editor without navigating the file system
jobs.frequency: 2-3 times per week for active framework contributors
jobs.importance: Reduces friction for framework extension and customization
success_criteria: Every component has a "Copy Path" button showing full file path
Clicking copies path to clipboard with visual confirmation
Paths are shown in detail view (e.g., `.claude/skills/Discovery_JTBD/SKILL.md`)
Developer can open file in editor within 10 seconds
jobs.desired_state: One-click path copy from documentation interface

jobs.title: Bookmark Frequently-Used Tools
jobs.statement: When I repeatedly use certain framework commands or skills, I want to save them as favorites, so I can access them instantly without searching.
jobs.when: I repeatedly use certain framework commands or skills
jobs.so_that: I can access them instantly without searching
success_criteria: Every component has "Add to Favorites" toggle
Favorites appear in a persistent sidebar or quick-access panel
Favorites persist across sessions (local storage or user profile)
Can reorder and remove favorites
jobs.current_state: Manually remembering file paths or creating personal bookmarks
jobs.desired_state: Built-in favorites system with quick-access shortcuts

jobs.title: Navigate Framework Hierarchies Visually
jobs.statement: When I'm learning the framework structure, I want to see a visual tree of skills → commands → agents with expand/collapse controls, so I can understand organizational hierarchy without reading folder names.
jobs.i_want_to: see a visual tree of skills → commands → agents with expand/collapse controls
jobs.so_that: I can understand organizational hierarchy without reading folder names
success_criteria: Hierarchical tree shows Skills, Commands, Agents with nested categories
Can expand/collapse categories (e.g., Discovery Skills, Prototype Skills)
Visual indentation and icons clarify parent-child relationships
Clicking tree node shows detail view
jobs.current_state: Reading folder structure in terminal or IDE
jobs.desired_state: Interactive tree widget with expand/collapse, icons, and click navigation

jobs.title: Compare Similar Framework Components
jobs.statement: When I'm deciding between similar skills or commands (e.g., `/discovery` vs `/discovery-multiagent`), I want to see side-by-side comparisons of features and use cases, so I can choose the right tool for my context.
jobs.when: I'm deciding between similar skills or commands (e.g., `/discovery` vs `/discovery-multiagent`)
jobs.i_want_to: see side-by-side comparisons of features and use cases
jobs.so_that: I can choose the right tool for my context
jobs.frequency: 1-2 times per project when choosing workflow approaches
success_criteria: Related components are linked in detail view (e.g., "See also: /discovery-multiagent")
Can open comparison view showing features, performance, use cases
Comparison highlights key differences (e.g., "60% faster", "requires agent coordination")
Decision guidance: "Use X when..., Use Y when..."
jobs.current_state: Reading multiple skill files separately and mentally comparing
jobs.desired_state: Side-by-side comparison table with decision criteria

jobs.title: Feel Confident Using the Framework
jobs.statement: When I'm applying the framework to a real project, I want to see validated examples and workflow diagrams, so I can trust that I'm using tools correctly and avoid costly mistakes.
jobs.when: I'm applying the framework to a real project
jobs.i_want_to: see validated examples and workflow diagrams
jobs.so_that: I can trust that I'm using tools correctly and avoid costly mistakes
jobs.importance: User confidence drives adoption and reduces support requests
success_criteria: Every component has at least one real-world usage example
Examples show command syntax, expected output, and common pitfalls
Workflow diagrams clarify when to use component in overall process
User confidence score > 80% (measured by post-training survey)
jobs.current_state: Reading raw skill files, uncertainty about correct usage
jobs.desired_state: Confidence-building examples, diagrams, and decision trees

jobs.title: Feel Autonomous in Framework Exploration
jobs.statement: When I want to learn a new framework capability, I want to explore documentation independently without asking colleagues, so I can maintain productivity and avoid dependency on experts.
jobs.when: I want to learn a new framework capability
jobs.i_want_to: explore documentation independently without asking colleagues
jobs.so_that: I can maintain productivity and avoid dependency on experts
jobs.frequency: Weekly when encountering new use cases
jobs.importance: Reduces expert bottlenecks and empowers users
success_criteria: Can answer 90% of framework questions without asking colleagues
Search + documentation covers common questions
Onboarding time reduced by 70%
Support ticket volume decreases by 60%

jobs.title: Be Perceived as Framework-Competent
jobs.statement: When I present framework capabilities to clients or stakeholders, I want to quickly access professional examples and diagrams, so I can demonstrate expertise and build credibility.
jobs.when: I present framework capabilities to clients or stakeholders
jobs.i_want_to: quickly access professional examples and diagrams
jobs.so_that: I can demonstrate expertise and build credibility
success_criteria: Can generate presentation-ready examples within 5 minutes
Documentation includes visual diagrams suitable for stakeholder demos
Can export component descriptions for client-facing materials
Professional appearance (not raw markdown files)
jobs.current_state: Manually creating slides from raw files
jobs.desired_state: One-click export of component diagrams and descriptions

jobs.title: Contribute to Team Framework Efficiency
jobs.statement: When I customize or improve a framework component, I want to share my changes with the team through the same documentation interface, so I can contribute to collective knowledge without separate communication.
jobs.when: I customize or improve a framework component
jobs.i_want_to: share my changes with the team through the same documentation interface
jobs.so_that: I can contribute to collective knowledge without separate communication
jobs.importance: Encourages knowledge sharing and framework evolution
success_criteria: Can annotate components with team-specific notes
Can submit documentation improvements via interface
Changes are visible to team members
Contribution activity is tracked and recognized
jobs.current_state: Separate communication channels (Slack, email) for sharing improvements
